Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics Resolution of Referents Groupings in Practical Dialogues

Section.Paragraph: This paper presents an extension to the Reference Domain Theory (Salmon-Alt, 2001) in order to solve plural references.

While this theory doesn't take plural reference into account in its original form, this paper shows how several entities can be grouped together by building a new domain and how they can be accessed later on. We introduce the notion of super-domain, representing the access structure to all the plural referents of a given type.
